requirements.summary: Add a bottom-left desktop rail button that opens the existing User Settings overlay via showUserSettings.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop layout, a settings button is visible in the bottom-left corner of the app UI (within the leftmost rail area).
Clicking the button sets the existing navigation state to open the User Settings overlay (the view rendered by UserSettingsShell via showUserSettings).
The button has an English tooltip/label (e.g., "User Settings" or "Profile Settings").
The button is keyboard accessible (reachable via Tab and activatable via Enter/Space).
Mobile behavior is not regressed (existing settings entry points in MobileTopBar/MobileShell continue to work).

file_operations.description: Add a new bottom-positioned "Profile Settings" (or "User Settings") control within the desktop left rail: import an appropriate icon (e.g., Settings) and wire its onClick to the existing navigation state setter (setShowUserSettings(true)) so MainContent renders UserSettingsShell. Ensure the control uses existing accessible button patterns (Button or button with aria-label) and an English Tooltip label, and keep the rail layout such that the control appears at the bottom-left area without affecting mobile entry points.
